docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 8 -- The Treasury announced today a reduction of 12 per cent in the additional duty imposed last May on imports of wool tops from Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 8 -- The Treasury announced today a reduction of 12 per cent in the additional duty imposed last May on imports of wool tops from Uruguay.
docs.abstract: US Treas cuts 'countervailing' duty on Uruguay wool tops from 18% to 6%, level of new 'bounty' paid by Uruguayan Govt to US exporters

headline.main: EXTRA DUTY IS CUT ON URUGUAY WOOL; ' Countervailing' Fee of 18% on Tops Is Reduced to 6%, Level of New 'Bounty'

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BONN, Germany, March 8 -- The West German Government is preparing an export drive into Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: BONN, Germany, March 8 -- The West German Government is preparing an export drive into Latin America.
docs.abstract: Min Erhard set for promotion tour

headline.main: BONN SEEKS TRADE OF LATIN AMERICA; Minister of Economics Will Tour Seven Nations in Bid for Increased Business

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 8 -- John Foster Dulles, United States Secretary of State, denounced international communism in the Americas as "alien intrigue and treachery" in a speech before the Tenth Inter-American Conference today.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 8 -- John Foster Dulles, United States Secretary of State, denounced international communism in the Americas as "alien intrigue and treachery" in a speech before the Tenth Inter-American Conference today.
docs.abstract: Dulles denounces internatl communism in hemisphere as 'alien intrigue and treachery,' s; notes resolutions provisions; in reply to Toriello, at length defines internatl communism; affirms conspiracy seeks to tie hemisphere to USSR orbit; sketches growth of USSR influence since '39; denies US fights freedom of ideas; avoids direct criticism of Guatemala and denies he accuses any govt or persons; speech seen strengthening US position; Toriello comments; Dulles cancels Phila speech date to stay till end of debate; Mex offers amendment to US resolution to condemn any totalitarian intervention; 1 Mex delegate sees US draft curbing pol thought; Dominican Repub, Paraguay, Uruguay, Cuba and Brazil back US

headline.main: DULLES CONDEMNS REDS FOR INTRIGUE IN THE AMERICAS; He Warns Caracas Meeting of Communist Peril While Defining U. S. Resolution HIS POSITION BOLSTERED Speech Impresses Delegates--Secretary Voices Plea for 'Appropriate' Steps DULLES ASSAILS RED 'TREACHERY'

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 9 -- Guatemala's principal delegate walked out of a plenary session today at the Tenth Inter-American Conference while the Dominican Foreign Minister was speaking on the Communist danger.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 9 -- Guatemala's principal delegate walked out of a plenary session today at the Tenth Inter-American Conference while the Dominican Foreign Minister was speaking on the Communist danger.
docs.abstract: Toriello and aides walk out of conf session during Min Balaguer (Dominican Repub) speech on Communist threat; return at end of s; Toriello comment; other speakers back US proposal; Sra Remon (Panama) offers amendment to end racial discrimination as way to fight communism; charges US discriminates against Panamanians in CZ; Amb Nunez Portuondo (Cuba) stresses Communist threat to hemisphere; speakers for 5 countries stress need for soc and econ betterment to fight threat

headline.main: GUATEMALA SNUBS ANTI-RED SPEAKER; Her Delegate Quits Caracas Session During Dominican's Attack -- U. S. Backed GUATEMALA SNUBS ANTI-RED SPEAKER

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 10 -- A long-standing boundary dispute between Ecuador and Peru suddenly became a hot issue at the Tenth Inter-American Conference today. It overshadowed the main question -- Communist intervention in the Americas -- at the...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 10 -- A long-standing boundary dispute between Ecuador and Peru suddenly became a hot issue at the Tenth Inter-American Conference today. It overshadowed the main question -- Communist intervention in the Americas -- at the Political Committee's meeting.
docs.abstract: debate on US resolution interrupted by Peru-Ecuador boundary dispute

headline.main: CLASH ON BORDER DISRUPTS PARLEY; Peru-Ecuador Issue Erupts at Caracas as Delegates Quarrel Over Arrests

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 11 -- Colombia and Peru were reported today to have virtually reached an agreement on the release of Victor Raul Haya de la Torre. The Peruvian radical leader has been in refuge in the Colombian Embassy in Lima for more than...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 11 -- Colombia and Peru were reported today to have virtually reached an agreement on the release of Victor Raul Haya de la Torre. The Peruvian radical leader has been in refuge in the Colombian Embassy in Lima for more than five years.
docs.abstract: accord on release reptd near; comment

headline.main: Haya de la Torte Near Freedom From Refuge in Lima Embassy; Peru and Colombia Are Held Agreed to Grant Passage to 'Prisoner' of Five Years

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 12 (AP) -- Louise Suggs held stoutly to her lead at the midway point of the women's Titleholders' golf tournament today despite a competitive course record of 70 turned in by Mrs. Babe Zaharias.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 12 (AP) -- Louise Suggs held stoutly to her lead at the midway point of the women's Titleholders' golf tournament today despite a competitive course record of 70 turned in by Mrs. Babe Zaharias.

headline.main: Mrs. Zaharias Fires Record 70, But Louise Suggs Retains Lead; Babe Gains Second With 146 in Augusta Titleholders' Golf, Trailing by Two Strokes

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 12 -- The United States delegation is confident the Tenth Inter-American Conference will pass a resolution tomorrow for joint action to be taken by the American republics if any of them came under Communist domination.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 12 -- The United States delegation is confident the Tenth Inter-American Conference will pass a resolution tomorrow for joint action to be taken by the American republics if any of them came under Communist domination.
docs.abstract: US confident of approval of resolution; Dulles says no states are now under Communist control, press conf; sees resolution as policy of prevention; Latin-Amer fears that it could be used against 'natl' Communist parties noted

headline.main: U. S. VICTORY SEEN IN CARACAS TODAY ON ANTI-RED STEP; Dulles Assures Conference Communists Do Not Rule Now in American States U. S. Victory Today at Caracas On Anti-Red Move Is Indicated

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO -- Dollar bargains and increasing hotel comfort nearly everywhere are prominent points in South America's attractions for tourists this year. Prices are rising everywhere in terms of the local currency, but so is the value of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO -- Dollar bargains and increasing hotel comfort nearly everywhere are prominent points in South America's attractions for tourists this year. Prices are rising everywhere in terms of the local currency, but so is the value of the dollar, and in many cases, as a result, prices for North Americans are comfortably lower than a year ago.
